column4: Newbie here again... Is it possible for me to get a 2.4 kernel that is already compiled, and load it on this pc such that I I can boot from it or the regular 2.6 kernel?  Thanks
unwise
you can remove modules from the kernel by doing "sudo modprobe -r module_name"
insert them by doing "modprobe module_name"
you do not delete them when you remove them, you just unload them from the kernel
stop using it?
btw try and use my nick when replying to me, i.e.: "Matt|": that way I can see your message better and can answer quickly
try using the tab button to complete nicks
you know the tab button?
start typing someones name
try Mat
yippeee  still an idiot but a slightly less offensive one ... !

now these modules of mine ... its a bit of a circle.  hsfconfig will not work for me because the hsfmodules are not loaded (I think),, don't I at least get a smily face for something for learning the very difficult tab thing ....:-!
now I feel better !
ok are you chatting on the computer you're trying to fix?
yup, with a sudo window open beside it
ok, I presume they are loaded at boot time?
Now your speakin my language!  hsfali
modprobe hsfali what do that give you?
returns Module hsfali not found
right, so who told you you needed that module?
